text: Esther Johnson was an American pitcher who played in the All-American Girls Professional Baseball League. She was born in Georgetown, South Carolina. According to the league's data, Esther Johnson played during the 1946 season. Nevertheless, additional information is incomplete because there are no records available at the time of the request.Madden, W. C. (2000) All-American Girls Professional Baseball League Record Book. McFarland & Company. The All- American Girls Professional Baseball League folded in 1954, but there is now a permanent display at the Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum at Cooperstown, New York since November 5, 1988 that honors those who were part of the league. Esther, along with the rest of the girls and the league staff, is included at the display/exhibit.Before A League of Their Own. National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum. Retrieved on September 5, 2016. ==References== Category:All- American Girls Professional Baseball League players Category:Baseball players from South Carolina Category:People from Georgetown, South Carolina Category:Date of birth missing Category:Possibly living people Category:Year of birth missing
title: Esther Johnson (baseball)
